title: Fundamental Research — Master Prompt
use_case: Validate the fundamental story of any stock in minutes — EPS growth, margins, catalysts, risks, and industry group strength.
prompt: For [TICKER], give me: last 4 quarters of EPS and revenue growth rates with acceleration or deceleration trend, gross and operating margin trend over the same period, the primary business catalyst driving current growth, any near-term risks or headwinds including secondary offerings or insider selling, and industry group strength and main competitors. Be concise and factual.

title: Fundamental Research — Narrative Prompt
use_case: Understand the institutional bull thesis and what would break it — before you look at a single chart.
prompt: For [TICKER], what is the core investment thesis that institutional investors are using to justify buying at current levels? What would need to be true for that thesis to break down? Be concise and specific.

title: News Synthesis Prompt
use_case: Cut through financial news noise and surface only what actually affects the stock — thesis developments, sector dynamics, and institutional activity.
prompt: For [TICKER], search for recent news from the last 30 days. Include the date of each development. Summarize only: (1) any developments that confirm or threaten the core growth thesis, (2) sector or competitor news that directly affects this company, (3) any notable institutional activity including large fund disclosures or insider buying. Be concise and factual.

title: Weekly Market Read
use_case: Generate a complete weekly market read in 60 seconds — sector leaderboard, growth stock opportunities, and a clear bias for the week ahead. Run every week to see where institutional money is flowing.
prompt:
Analyze the current U.S. stock market environment as of today and provide a structured weekly market read for a growth stock trader. Use real-time data and recent price action to complete the following:

1. Overall Market Bias
State the current market environment in one word: Risk-On, Risk-Off, or Neutral. Follow with 2-3 sentences explaining why, referencing recent SPY, QQQ, and IWM price action and any relevant macro context.

2. Sector Leaderboard
Rank all 11 S&P 500 sectors from strongest to weakest based on 1-week performance. Use the following ETFs as proxies: XLK, XLY, XLC, XLV, XLF, XLI, XLE, XLB, XLRE, XLU, XLP. For each sector show: Rank, Sector name, ETF ticker, 1-week % change, and a one-line characterization (Leading / Neutral / Lagging).

3. Growth Stock Opportunities This Week
Based on the sector leaderboard above, identify the 2-3 sectors currently showing the strongest conditions for growth stock setups — regardless of which sectors they are. For each: explain why it is attracting institutional interest, what type of growth stocks within that sector are worth watching, and what would confirm or invalidate the opportunity heading into the week.

4. Weekly Bias Statement
In 2-3 sentences, summarize what this environment means for a growth stock trader heading into the week. Should they be aggressive, selective, or defensive? What is the single most important thing to watch?
